required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Hematological Malignancy With Novel CAR-T Cells.
clinical_study.official_title: Adoptive Immunotherapy for Hematological Malignancy With Novel CAR-T Cells.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, early phase I study, to determine the safety and efficacy of Novel CAR-T cell therapy in Hematological Malignancy treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The Novel CAR-T contains either a scFv plus a PD-L1 blocker, or two scFvs, in a cytokine complex based outer memberane structure, this kind of structure enables the CAR-T cells to simultaneously target one or two targets on the tumor cell surface and enhance CAR-T cell persistence in tumor microenvironment，as well as stimulating innate T/NK cell activation and expansion.

primary_outcome.measure: safety (Incidence of treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.03)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.03

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete response rate[CR] (Complete response rate per the revised International Working Group (IWG) Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma)
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response rate per the revised International Working Group (IWG) Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Partial response rate [PR] (Partial response rate per the revised International Working Group (IWG) Response Criteria)
secondary_outcome.description: Partial response rate per the revised International Working Group (IWG) Response Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (The time from response to relapse or progression)
secondary_outcome.description: The time from response to relapse or progression

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (The time from the first day of treatment to the date on which disease progresses)
secondary_outcome.description: The time from the first day of treatment to the date on which disease progresses

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (The number of patient alive, with or without signs of cancer)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patient alive, with or without signs of cancer

arm_group.description: Novel CAR-T cells will be administered intravenously

intervention.description: A conditioning chemotherapy regimen of fludarabine and cyclophosphamide may be administered, followed by a single infusion of Novel CAR-T cells
